sources.title: Alexandra
sources.description: Title: Alexandra Summary: Revolution breaks out in a small European kingdom, and a young princess is forced to flee for her life. She heads for the neighboring country, which just happens to be ruled by the king she... Directed by: Maurice Elvey Actors: Evelyn Laye, Henry Wilcoxon, Yvonne Arnaud Production Company: Gainsborough Pictures Release Date: 21 June 1935 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 Revolution breaks out in a small European kingdom, and a young princess is forced to flee for her life. She heads for the neighboring country, which just happens to be ruled by the king she is betrothed to. Unfortunately, the new revolutionary government won't let citizens leave, which she actually doesn't mind all that much because she's not particularly jazzed about marrying the elderly king. He sends a young naval officer to bring her across the border, but in order to do so they are forced into a marriage of convenience. Complications ensue.

metadata.Plot: Revolution breaks out in a small European kingdom, and a young princess is forced to flee for her life. He sends a young naval officer to bring her across the border, but in order to do so they are forced into a marriage of convenience. Complications ensue.
metadata.Writer: Arthur Wimperis, Lauri Wylie, F. Martos
metadata.Actors: Evelyn Laye, Henry Wilcoxon, Yvonne Arnaud
